title: The new fiora - she might actually be strong.
body:
After the latest hotfix buffs and more games, i think she is fine now. I played some more games and she defenitely seems like a very rewarding champion when played properly. She COULD use a very tiny buff here and there but i think its not really needed. People will discover her soon enough probably, despite her abysmal 39% winrate.

 [I also made a montage on the new fiora, hopefully people can see that she is actually quite good.]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mSbUDwudF8c


Anyway, what do you think of the new fiora and what do you personally build on her? I have tried some builds however im always open to new ones and im just generally interested.

I also would like to hear something from riot's perspective on the new fiora. Riot is (usually) right on their predictions, like mallet gnar. Their designers defenitely deserve more credit.

replies.body: Current theory is that she might be a bit strong after the buffs (as opposed to far too weak beforehand). She's performing quite well at present, and probably still has some significant learning curve left for people who've just started playing the rework, so will likely do better again over the next couple of weeks. No immediate plans to nerf her in 5.16 though, her being too strong's very much still a possibility rather than a conclusion.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L4cQxnz3,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-08-15T20:57:39.376+0000)
>
> Current theory is that she might be a bit strong after the buffs (as opposed to far too weak beforehand). She's performing quite well at present, and probably still has some significant learning curve left for people who've just started playing the rework, so will likely do better again over the next couple of weeks. No immediate plans to nerf her in 5.16 though, her being too strong's very much still a possibility rather than a conclusion.

although i'm not necessarily an advocate of being trigger-happy with the nerf gun, fiora's potential will only get closer to being realized as more people get better at her

Agreed. There's not a current need to act on anything though, so we can afford to wait at least a patch to confirm whether or not there is a problem to address, understand what to target if so, figure out how a large a change is needed etc. Leaving stuff unaddressed too long's definitely a cost, so are knee jerk reactions though. Trying to find that sweet spot between the two's something we've been putting a lot of effort into.

im wondering tho--kassadin was nerfed for like almost a year and a half straight, and left long in the state hes currently in. People make threads and intelligent discussion about him but no one ever chips in. why?
Same way I felt about {{champion:98}} until a few months ago when RiotScruffy adressed himabd a couple after where Meddler followed up on it. Kas's time will come. . .

I'm a bit tired of Shen tbh, he counters my main toplaners {{champion:75}} {{champion:122}}.

Against Nasus he just teleports botlane and gets the game snowballed before Nasus can ever reach late game, and Nasus has no way of interrupting the channel. Against Darius he's just too tanky to kill in lane, and that giant shield on his ult pretty much says "Fuck you" to Darius if he tries to drop the axe anyone else.
guess they don't care for {{champion:38}} {{item:3070}}

Trying to find that sweet spot between the two's something we've been putting a lot of effort into.

Considering you hotfixed her with buffs in the middle of a patch... No reason you can't "hotfix" her with nerfs a week into 5.16, right?

:P

Hey, one thing i saw in a match with the new fiora was that she was able to parry ignite, i don't think that should be allowed. My friend was top laning as Jayce and he had ignited to finish her off so he can just walk away. But he freaked out saying she blocked his ignite it clearly showed his ignite had just gone on cooldown in the scoreboard.

> so we can afford to wait at least a patch to confirm whether or not there is a problem to address

Please do this more.
I am a guy that likes data. What numbers you see support this conclusion? What is the ideal success rate of Fiora ultimate as deemed by design?
Holy crap words rito has never said before actually waiting to see how changed affect something before changing them again half life 3 confirmed.

> [{quoted}](name=spookyjugular,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L4cQxnz3,comment-id=0004000000000003,timestamp=2015-08-16T09:05:09.032+0000)
>
> Holy crap words rito has never said before actually waiting to see how changed affect something before changing them again half life 3 confirmed.

Keep in mind that reworks like these are a freaking yo yo. As soon as people figure out how to play her, they need to start figuring out how to play against her. And until they do, she will have an inflated win rate.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L4cQxnz3,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-08-15T20:57:39.376+0000)
>
> Current theory is that she might be a bit strong after the buffs (as opposed to far too weak beforehand). She's performing quite well at present, and probably still has some significant learning curve left for people who've just started playing the rework, so will likely do better again over the next couple of weeks. No immediate plans to nerf her in 5.16 though, her being too strong's very much still a possibility rather than a conclusion.

Sweet, one of my favorite designers commented.

This might be odd for me to ask, but what is fiora supposed to itemize for? Right now people are trying out all sorts of builds. What has been working best for me is Trinity Force, however from a designer standpoint, what is fiora supposed to itemize for?

Our main priorities with her itemization were to reward AD significantly and to ensure that tanky builds weren't the optimal way to go (we did see some tanky buids dominate during the reworks development at times, and full defense/CDR Fiora felt extremely wrong relative to the themes and playstyle we were trying to hit). 

Trinity Force is something we went back and forth on a bit. Main thing we wanted to avoid was builds that went Trinity into straight tank stats. The champion update team did spend a lot of time discussing what the costs and benefits of TF as a dominant, feasible and suboptimal choice were though. Far as I know their eventual conclusion was to aim for 'decent, particularly for some playstyles, but far from mandatory'.

So you're concerned that many players are building too much defense on her? I think people are vastly overestimating the usefulness of a bruiser build. I've found much more success with the AD-stacking build (akin to Riven) with the only item that gives "defensive" stats being Black Cleaver.

I just plain do not like Trinity Force on Fiora IMO and I agree that it is not mandatory at all on her. It is an overused item on bruisers and stacking AD and CDR allows Fiora to hit hard against tanks, no matter what they build. Nothing is more satisfying than able to duel and defeat a tank who has 3000 and 300+ armor in the same amount of time as you would kill a squishy carry when you have 400-500 AD thanks to her true damage passive.

If you were to make changes to Fiora after this patch, I would totally agree with encouraging the full AD build over the copycat bruiser build. I like seeing things like Ravenous Hydra, Bloodthirster, and even Essence Reaver on her. I like boot choices like Boots of Swiftness and Boots of Lucidity over Ninja Tabi or Mercs. I like that no matter who her opponent is, she is able to duel them, provided she has skill and precision.

A bruiser build is reserved for champions like Garen or Darius who withstand the brunt of long fights. Fiora, however, to me strikes as someone who can defeat someone in 4-5 precise strikes.

I have seen people absolutely destroy with her. Many didnt believe people saying she was strong.

But on an objective level. She has among the highest win rate atm. 54% among plat+ 65% when she gets trinity (first or second item powerspike). 20% dmg over average.

We told you guys she is strong, you didnt want to change your habits of her build path, and did poorly. (to the fiora mains)

Now i dont mind her being strong or anything. but when the patch 5:16 will go thru. She will receive buffs. Will probably see competitive. and she will get a balance team kick in the butt of a lifetime. I am saying this because you all claimed (most of you) Major buffs. I think you guys will regret it and im not rejoicing any nerfs on any champs.

Meddler (NA) - about 3 hours ago

**''Current theory is that she might be a bit strong after the buffs (as opposed to far too weak beforehand). She's performing quite well at present, and probably still has some significant learning curve left for people who've just started playing the rework, so will likely do better again over the next couple of weeks. No immediate plans to nerf her in 5.16 though, her being too strong's very much still a possibility rather than a conclusion.''**

I will disagree with meddler that she was that weak beforehand. the buffs werent that huge. how can a champ changes with 15% win rate difference just with some base stats tweak. with humongous strenght in triforce powerspike?
she was severally underrated

I wouldn't trust the Trinity Force winrate. It may simply be an effect of getting ahead and getting a good trade/kill in lane. [The Black Cleaver has an almost similar winrate when picked up as a 2nd item](http://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/items/fiora/top/platinum). This leads me to believe that it's actually _the Phage component_ of the items that is making her do well. I then looked even further and checked LoLKing for more stats. It turns out that [Boots of Swiftness and the Furor enchantment is very popular on Fiora](http://www.lolking.net/items/1305) (~18%) and actually has a ~73% winrate. That's pretty amazing if you ask me. This definitely matches my experience with Fiora. I was never able to proc Vitals sufficiently until I specced into movement speed.

I don't disagree entirely, but for one I would like to add, is that the balance of a champion is not solely determined by who plays her, but also who plays against her. I think fiora is weak atm mainly cause she has a lot of counters / outplays. I believe when people learn how fiora works, they wont be so quick to burn there CC until after her W, which will be a complete game changer in fights.. All in all, I agree with meddler , only time with tell, but my current opinion is that she is underwhelming :P and once she becomes more active people will figure out how to counter her.

Hold up! Found something that I think has not been realized when designing her kit!
_(not played new Fiora yet)_

___

> [{quoted}](name=Shénzhì,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JphHbNmN,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-08-15T00:34:07.550+0000)
>
> [_**QUOTE**_](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/f/3ErqAdtq/d/JphHbNmN?comment=0000)

the Problem?:
> Lunge, hit Vital, press [E] and [R]. Suddenly a new Vital in same place.
>
> Extra bonus significant damage unintended? Am I wrong?

 its Solution?:
> When hitting a Vital there ought to cancel-out Vitals appearing there temporarily including ultimate activation. I think it does this already but not for her ultimate?
So in this sequence:
>
> 2. hit Vital; Vital disappears.
> 3. Vital cannot reappear there yet.
> 4. _(new)_ Casting ultimate immediately after hitting  Vital will show visual representation of Vital recent hit, unready.
> (Visual represents the cooldown of that specific Vital reappearing)
>   * If cast ultimate before hitting Vital, all four Vitals are ready (not just 3 with 4th waiting).
> 5. Resume hitting all three Vitals and then the fourth.

> _What has happened?_
I just significantly _controlled_ her damage output with this idea.

Probably other ideas on the table, though.

Da's bad though.
You are punishing her for going all in, not to mention the time it takes for a new vital to reappear already takes out almost 1/4 the duration.
I don't have a solution, but this isn't the way to do it.

It's not punishment. What?

It's a logical correction. It's identifying a flaw.
I'm confident it is the way ... but could be changed:

* During [R], the unready fourth Vital resets if hit one other Vital. It now begins a _faster_ cooldown like those of normal Vital attacks (no ultimate).
Perfect! :p

Identifying a flaw for someone who hasn't played the new fiora? that's not logic, that's just arrogance. I agree with Mastersomething, fiora has few rewards for going all in, taking that slight advantage away will be a huge nerf to her. Also it would rework her ult.. requiring her to wait even longer to hit 4 marks?? That would mean her ult would need to last longer than 8secs.  Sorry but I disagree, that would be a huge hindrance to her already misunderstood kit.

Arrogance?

No.

It will work. Continuing hitting the other 3 Vitals will ready-up the 4th Vital. If you're taking too long, it will ready-up anyway. It may be longer but that just depends on the player's master, doesn't it.. It won't be so easy to land a double % True Damage within 0.5 seconds anymore! That goes without saying additional on-hit effects from items.

In the end, she'll play the same as before so there's no problem with this single idea.

Arrogance? lol...

But my statement still stands, if you never played fiora, you lack the understanding of how difficult this is to preform. You cant just say "Oh wow I think this would work great cause surely I can do it" that's not how games actually play out. You have to account the other players skill as well as your own, and 9/10 if there smart, there not gonna let you hit your vital. So unless you can provide some logical way for a melee champ like fiora, to dive head first into the enemy, not die, hit 3 hits on the rear side, and wait another few secs for her 4th to pop up, all while in the middle of a team fight.... Ima just call you crazy.

In all honestly play fiora before you think this is easy to preform. Anyone that is here can tell you, you cannot proc all 4 vitals every time, and making them even harder to proc in 1v1 scenarios is even more Ludacris.

-------------------------
Also .
> In the end, she'll play the same as before so there's no problem with this single idea
Arrogant - having or revealing an exaggerated sense of one's own importance or abilities.

Your statement was the prime example of arrogance. If not, just plain stupidity. So I am not going to here to argue an opinion. If you think its simple to do, fair enough, that's just your thoughts... But for the love of god, If you never played the new fiora, please don't post shit like this.    it offers more opinions than actual facts , especially if your just assuming your knowledge of her kit from what you SEEN, or HEARD form others ~_~.

Because FYI, Fioras ult doesn't cancel her auto attack, so unless the other fiora is Extremely good, or someone is just really bad, most likely she wont hit another vital in the same spot easily unless they stand still or she Q's for it.  And if she does Waste her Q, she will have to wait another 4sec cd just to hit the other one.. meaning she gets 2 vitals from her ult, and one vital from her passive ( which is barely enough damage ). so that extra vital hit from her passive doesn't seem that op to me
Eh, still, if you can't hit that vital a second time, most likely your target will escape and/or will make an already hard ult harder to proc.
Good job if they escape Fiora's ultimate. Maybe they're just _high mobility_ champs that can simply counter Fiora's ultimate that way. Mordekaiser wouldn't be able to do that, would he.

Then you have:
A: An ally lock the target down for you, or
B: You WAIT until the target's dashes are down.
Not to mention she also blocks all spells. Ignite, Ultimates, Everything.
My biggest problem isn't her strength, I just don't like the vitals aspect of her kit.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L4cQxnz3,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-08-15T20:57:39.376+0000)

Not to be rude, but when all my friends tell me not to play Fiora because she adds nothing to a team-comp... I think she's still weak. 

Fiora still hasn't been picked - and likely never will be picked - in an LCS game. 

I'm still trying to figure out why I can't hit vital spots while standing on the correct side of my enemy, but still in my enemy's hitbox.

PS: I'm still waiting for my Royal Guard Fiora refund.
A lot of those players could of killed you had they kept attacking instead of running

For the new fiora, I don't go her old fiora build and go full melee adc build; instead, I build 2-3 damage items with a main focus on survivability (my typical damage items are Maw, Hydra, and BT) and the rest of the items are full tank. I usually rush a damage item, then alternate with a tank item, then alternate with another damage item. Because of Fiora's new ult, it's essential to survive in a team fight long enough to proc the heal, as well as do consistent damage through your passive, hence all of the lifesteal and tanky items.
Edit: Also, the new Fiora is extremely skill-based, so if you feel really good with her you can go 4 ad items and still win.

I discovered her already.. I've been playing rankeds and all. Silver II from III (playing her, and yes I made the difference)

Her ultimate when popped off makes all the difference in close/even matches.
the new fiora is soo squishy ...

Her lane power is extremely strong. You can pretty much all in at level 1 if you see enemy weak point in front of you. 
The problem comes in teamfight (at least for me) where using the ult becomes a lot harder.
What are your Runes, MAsteries and Itemsets?

I go Black Cleaver, Hydra, Last Whisper for offense, and usually pick up Dead Man's Plate and Banshee's for defense.

I run AD reds, scaling CDR blues, MS quints, and armor golds, with 22/5/3 masteries (favoring CDR in offense and picking up movement speed in utility).

39% winrate? Since her rework i played her 22 times, won 18 of those and hit mastery level 5. In at least half of those games people were complaining about how OP she is, and freaked out when i told them of the plans of buffing her.
I honestly don't think she really needs those buffs, she's just really really difficult to do well with.
she IS strong

Riot overbuffed her .

Couldn't help but notice that you cut out the 3 losses to make her look OP. Win streaks exist.

If you want some build i have a pretty cool one. 

Into ad match-ups with soft or hard peal this build works. makes you impossible to kite.

Iceborn Gauntlet into cleaver plus 5% cdr glyphs. this means you can can cdr and take any boots you want plus ot have any mana issues. for roaming q is free and gives you alot of kill pressure.

This will be much better next patch as armor is getting nerfed. fior scales with cdr and ad, triforce seems like bait, all you only want it for the passives. this build has that. 

as regarding items to get after its free reign, tiamat has insane wave clear and good dueling (also aoe's cleaver) or last whispers into tanks, even with the true damage you deal 90% physical. 

then you can go straight tank as you heal scales with lvl not ad or full dps

Only Kassa top has lower winrate than her atm. How is she needing nerfs? (I've looked champion.gg ,top, winrate).
Wu has 55 % winrate with similar pickrate to her, Malphite - 54 % winrate with bigger pickrate than her.
And you wanna nerf her. 
WHY?????
Well I can't ever win lane against her as {{champion:122}} her supposed counter. The buffs might have been a little too much.

that video sadly confirms my own experience with fiora: The passive has verly little impact on her playstyle, it isn't realevant enough. She's prettymuch the same old rightclick till it's dead champ, just that her W now has insane potential in skilled hands while Q offers a bit more juke potential.
I haven't seen a clutch outplay resolving around getting a passive proc in that montage, but serveral situation in which the W had imense impact, else it was pretty much the old q-aa-e-aa-q-aa-aa-e-aa-q-aa-aa-e-aa-qe-aa-ea-aeae-a stuff old fiora was known for, just with a bit more focus on burstspikes with new E and some jukes with Q...
Her Ult adds slightly more, but i haven't seen it popping all 4 zones, usually 2 + the good old rightclick game, useing the absurd heal after the kill to survive minons/tower or turn around a 1v2...

I really wish her passive was more impactfull and needed compared to q+aa+e, while she could use some better tools to really use it.
She still doesn't feel like danceing arounf her opponent to hit a weak spot, it'sa bit more about tactical withdraw and reengage with her more burst/hit and run rather than dps centered q+w+e, but still mostly straight forward...

Can you give some tips for a guy trying to get better at the new Fiora? I find it depends a bit on matchups too much how I do; I won against a Renekton, but got utterly destroyed by Mordekaiser. Usually when I play her I attract a lot of flame for playing a champion that was recently reworked with a low winrate, so I'd like to shut them up a bit more by playing her "properly". I don't think I fail to grasp the fundamentals, but could you share some hints on particular tricks (I'd understand if you'd rather keep the best to yourself!) or itemisation hints? How to enter a teamfight?

She seems pretty good, even though the sadist in me misses the Blade Waltz. The one thing I find lacking in the rework is that, as someone who uses her mostly in the jungle, that her passive does not work on large & epic monsters, thus taking the sustain away from her early clears.

Edit: I was watching Hai's stream last night, and he said almost the same thing, that Fiora has the makings of a good jungler if her passive worked on the camps.

I really LOVE this new Fiora, fun as hell to play.
Regarding build, I usually start with Rushing Hydra, then building right into Trinity Force.
After wards, depending on what the situation calls for, Frozen Mallet (For a little tankiness and chasing potential), Spirit Visage (the MR is great and the heal buff is really nice), and Boots of Swiftness (More mobility)! Last thing I build is usually the most situational. Mercurial Scimitar for heavy CC team comps or to deal with that annoying Malz, Bloodthirster if I need to last longer after fights before backing, and GA if you are very fed but need to be even more tanky for your team (though I have yet to try this item on her).
Finally glad people are starting to see her OPness.
her win rate is low becuz fools go into ranked despite not learning her
